2023 Indian filmDvand: The Internal ConflictOfficial release posterDirected byIshtiyak KhanWritten byIshtiyak KhanProduced byVikas VashisthaRohandeep SinghStarringSanjay MishraIshtiyak KhanCinematographyChandra Shekhar RathEdited bySandeep Singh BajeliMusic byRohit SharmaProductioncompaniesJumping Tomato StudiosVsquare FilmsRelease date
29 September 2023 (2023-09-29)
CountryIndiaLanguageHindi
Dvand: The Internal Conflict is a 2023 Indian Hindi-language drama film written and directed by Ishtiyak Khan. It stars Ishtiyak Khan, Sanjay Mishra, Vikram Kochhar and Ipshita Chakraborty. It was released theatrically on 29 September 2023.[1]


Cast[edit]
Ishtiyak Khan as Bhola
Vishwanath Chatterjee as Bhaiyaji
Sanjay Mishra as Guruji
Ipshitaa as Naini [2]
Tina Bhatia as Raziya
Vikram Kochhar
Faiz Khan Raziya's husband
Production[edit]
Dvand: The Internal Conflict was shot in Jharkhand[3]

Plot summary[edit]
The movie is a comedic adaptation of Shakespeare's play, "Othello," combining elements of humor and adventure.[4]

Reception[edit]
Critical response[edit]
A reviewer of The Free Press Journal wrote "However, the internal conflict, competitive and jealousy in the minds of people can be watched at least once to encourage the makers".[5] Ritu Tripati from India TV wrote "it definitely feels like it has been drawn forcibly. But if you like realistic acting and down-to-earth characters then you will surely enjoy it".[6] Rahul Chouhan from Aaj Tak wrote "If you want to watch a serious 'low' comedy film showing social evils, then you will like 'Dwand The Internal Conflict'".[7] Shikha Yadav from NDTV says "Like the story of the film, its direction has also been done well. But at some places the story starts getting a bit slow and boring and looking at some scenes it seems as if an attempt has been made to add them forcefully".[8] Priya Shukla from News18 India says "However, at some places the story seems to be lax. There are some scenes which look as if there was no need for this scene. As if it was just added forcefully".[9]

References[edit]


^ "Sanjay Mishra's 'Dvand-The Internal Conflict' will be released on September 29, The first look poster launched". The Times of India. 6 September 2023. Archived from the original on 2 October 2023. Retrieved 28 November 2023.

^ "Actress Ipshita Chakraborty Singh opens up about her character and reuniting with Sanjay Sir in 'Dvand : The Internal Conflict'". The Times of India. 29 September 2023. Archived from the original on 29 September 2023. Retrieved 28 November 2023.

^ "बॉलीवुड फिल्म दंद की झारखंड में हुई है। शूटिंग, दिखेगा पलामू का मेदिनीनगर और यहां के कलाकार". Prabhat Khabar (in Hindi). 25 September 2023. Archived from the original on 15 October 2023. Retrieved 28 November 2023.

^ "Sanjay Mishra's 'Dvand-The Internal Conflict' will be released on September 29, The first look poster launched".

^ "Dvand-The Internal Conflict Review: Sanjay Mishra's Film Is Inspired By Shakespeare's Othello With A Pinch Of Humour". The Free Press Journal. 30 September 2023. Archived from the original on 1 October 2023. Retrieved 28 November 2023.

^ "Dvand The Internal Conflict Review: Sanjay Mishra proves his versatility yet again". India TV. 30 September 2023. Archived from the original on 4 October 2023. Retrieved 28 November 2023.

^ "Dvand- The Internal Conflict Review: सामाजिक मुद्दों पर किरदारों का 'द्वंद', नाटक के बहाने सिस्टम पर चोट करती फिल्म". Aaj Tak (in Hindi). 2 October 2023. Archived from the original on 6 October 2023. Retrieved 28 November 2023.

^ "Dvand Movie Review: जिंदगी में होने वाले द्वंद को दिखाती है संजय मिश्रा की ये फिल्म, देखिए गांव में कैसे बनेगा पहला नाटक". NDTV (in Hindi). 30 September 2023. Archived from the original on 4 October 2023. Retrieved 28 November 2023.

^ "Dvand Movie Review: 'नाटक तुमने शुरू किया, खत्म हम करेंगे' जिंदगी में होने वाले द्वंद को दिखाती है संजय मिश्रा की फिल्म". News18 India (in Hindi). 30 September 2023. Archived from the original on 9 October 2023. Retrieved 28 November 2023.
